intro: Phyllostegia konaensis, commonly known as Kona false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Phyllostegia konaensis is an important part of the local ecosystem and is considered a rare and endemic species.
